image.altText: A young woman wearing white shirt with blue jumper around her shoulders, sniffs a red rose

props.synopsis: Long before Greg Lynn was convicted of murder in Victoria's High Country, his estranged wife died suddenly at home in Mount Macedon. Now, some of those closest to Lisa Lynn are pushing for the coroner to re-examine her death.

title.children: On a cold morning in Mount Macedon, walkers discover a body. This is Lisa Lynn's story

image.altText: A close up of Greg Lynn standing in front of a body of water near some rocks.

props.synopsis: Decades before Greg Lynn was convicted of murdering an elderly camper in Victoria's High Country, he subjected his first wife to abuse and death threats as their marriage deteriorated, an ABC investigation has revealed.

title.children: After years of silence, Greg Lynn's former in-laws detail a dark past

image.altText: A man with dark hair and glasses in a suit.

props.synopsis: Bruce Lehrmann has lost his appeal against a Federal Court ruling that found on the balance of probabilities he raped his then-colleague Brittany Higgins in 2019.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann may turn to High Court following appeal loss: lawyer

image.altText: A teenager looks down at a smartphone screen displaying the Snapchat logo, a yellow screen with a white ghost cartoon

props.synopsis: From December 10, young people will lose access to part of their online world. Here's how to support them.

title.children: How to prepare yourself and your child for the social media ban on December 10

image.altText: A military helicopter in flight against the sky.

props.synopsis: As the United States attempts to broker a peace deal at the Kremlin in Moscow, it is expected a significant funding boost from Canberra to aid Ukraine's war efforts is imminent.

title.children: Government considers offloading retiring Tiger helicopters to Ukraine

image.altText: Crowds of people walk from the Martin Place station in central sydney.

props.synopsis: Australia's economy expanded 0.4 per cent in the September quarter, coming in below forecasts and posting a slowdown from the previous three months. Follow live.

title.children: GDP misses forecasts but economists say rate cuts not back on table

image.altText: A Malaysian Airlines Boeing 777 plane takes off from Kuala Lumpur airport.

props.synopsis: The search for missing Malaysia Airlines Flight MH370 will resume at the end of December, more than a decade after the Beijing-bound flight disappeared.

title.children: Search for missing flight MH370 to resume this month, Malaysia says

image.altText: A building with a maroon sign that says "Keysborough College" and purple and white vertical signs, one saying "respect".

props.synopsis: A 37-year-old teacher accused of stabbing a principal at a school in Melbourne's south-east on Tuesday "snapped" after learning his contract would not be renewed, a court has heard.

title.children: Teacher 'snapped' over contract before stabbing principal, court hears

image.altText: A smartphone with the YouTube logo, with the website in the background behind it.

props.synopsis: YouTube agrees to comply with Australia's under 16s social media ban but repeats its criticism of the law and says it "won't keep teens safer online". Follow live.

title.children: YouTube 'outright weird' for saying platform isn't safe, Anika Wells says

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Coalition says national accounts figures show economy is 'limping towards Christmas'
Australian aircraft spots Chinese flotilla in Philippine Sea
Wells says it's 'outright weird' YouTube thinks its content is unsafe

image.altText: A close-up of Donald Trump smiling.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says his country is at war with "narco-terrorists". But he is freeing the former president of Honduras, who was jailed in the US for overseeing one of the world's worst drug conspiracies.

title.children: Amid 'war on drugs', Trump frees right-wing leader jailed for trafficking

image.altText: Travis Head looks over his shoulder as he completes a shot.

props.synopsis: The second Ashes Test is upon us and we have fingers crossed it will last more than two days. Here's everything you need to know.

title.children: What time does the Gabba Test start and everything else you need to know

image.altText: Woman in long blue dress smiles at camera in the doorway of her shop front

props.synopsis: Frustrated retailers grappling with online shoplifters are calling for better protections from banks, payment providers and regulators.

title.children: 'It's theft': The online shoppers receiving their orders then claiming refunds

image.altText: A man speaking in parliament.

props.synopsis: A stadium on Hobart's waterfront has gained enough support to pass parliament, after key independents declared they would support the contentious project. Follow live.

title.children: Hobart stadium secures enough support to pass parliament

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: The Hobart stadium vote is set to PASS
Enough YES votes means stadium will happen

image.altText: Two people holding photos of a young boy

props.synopsis: The parents of a young man with a neuromuscular disease who died seven days after spinal surgery say they have serious concerns about the post-operative care he was provided at Royal Perth Hospital.

title.children: Parents question post-operative care after son's sudden death

image.altText: optus 'yes' sign on glass fronted office block

props.synopsis: Optus apologises for NBN internet outages affecting Brisbane and some other parts of Queensland.

title.children: Brisbane hit with widespread Optus internet outages

image.altText: woman curled up in white bed linen asleep

props.synopsis: What you wear to bed can affect the quality of your sleep. And if that's nothing at all, there are a few things to consider.

title.children: Is it better to sleep naked or wear pyjamas?

image.altText: A silhouette of a person wheeling a bike through a tunnel into a cycling velodrome.

props.synopsis: Filmmaking siblings Tristan and Timothy Kenyon's documentary Changing Track explores how competing in the Paralympics changes lives.

title.children: New doco follows three Paralympians to Paris as we gear up for Brisbane 2032

image.altText: Two young primary school girls working together in a classroom

props.synopsis: Parents can check the latest NAPLAN scores for 10,000 schools across the country on the MySchool website.

title.children: The 'secret sauce' powering schools punching above their weight in NAPLAN

image.altText: A woman in a long-sleeved blue dress stands between two men in suits and red ties

props.synopsis: Tech billionaires Michael and Susan Dell have pledged $US6.25 billion ($9.5 billion) to new investment accounts for children, known as "Trump accounts". Here's how the donation will work.

title.children: Michael and Susan Dell donate nearly $10b to 'Trump accounts'

image.altText: Pete Hegseth speaking with his hands slightly raised.

props.synopsis: US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth defends authorising a follow-up strike on a Venezuelan boat that killed 11 people.

title.children: Hegseth defends second US strike on alleged Venezuelan drug boat

image.altText: Donald Trump waving, Melania Trump is in the background.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says he is terminating all documents, including pardons, signed by his predecessor Joe Biden using an autopen signature.

title.children: Trump says he is terminating documents signed by Biden using autopen

image.altText: Hugh Jackman standing on top of a pub bar singing

props.synopsis: Hugh Jackman sung the crowd-pleaser Sweet Caroline and even climbed onto the top of the bar counter for the performance.

title.children: Hugh Jackman surprises fans with impromptu New York pub performance

image.altText: Nova Peris and  Mack Horton with members of the community.

props.synopsis: With Olympians on board and a cargo of presents, the Royal Australian Air Force is getting a head start on Santa with Exercise Christmas Hop.

title.children: Air force and Olympians team up for special Christmas exercise

image.altText: A woman facing away from the camera in a wilderness area.

props.synopsis: The Trump administration's escalating restrictions on humanitarian migration are leaving some of the United States's most vulnerable diaspora communities terrified for their futures.

title.children: Humanitarian migrants in US fear being deported into danger following shooting

image.altText: Police and Fire and Rescue officers walking to light coloured car overturned on train tracks, bridge above

props.synopsis: Delays on some Sydney train lines are expected to continue into Wednesday afternoon after a car crashed onto train tracks in the Blue Mountains.

title.children: Car falls from bridge, lands on train tracks sparking lengthy rail delays

image.altText: Black and white picture with a father holding two toddlers and one is helping father drink beer.

props.synopsis: Kimura Dixon, 45, was killed and his 19-year-old stepson sustained serious injuries when a retaining wall collapsed at a construction site in Brisbane on Tuesday morning.

title.children: Worker killed in retaining wall collapse remembered as 'amazing father'

image.altText: Alex and Vicky Ryvchin outside former Dover Heights home after it was vandalised, red paint on white wall

props.synopsis: Executive Council of Australian Jewry Alex Ryvchin said the data showed antisemitism remained at "deeply troubling levels".

title.children: Report details attacks and abuse faced by Australian Jews

image.altText: Women in white gowns with red and gold embroidery lined up behind each other in the street.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Palestinians turn out in Gaza's Khan Younis to celebrate the wedding of 54 couples who had been unable to tie the knot during Israel's bombardment of the strip.

title.children: Thousands gather in Gaza to celebrate 54 couples finally getting married

image.altText: A woman in a polka-dot hijab holds one small child, while another one cries at her side amid the ruins of a flooded home.

props.synopsis: More than 1,300 people are dead and 1.2 million displaced following devastating flooding and landslides in South-East Asia.

title.children: More than 1 million people left homeless by deadly floods in South-East Asia

image.altText: A man walks out of Darwin Local Court using a hat to conceal most of his face.

props.synopsis: A 44-year-old man has been charged with murder of the death of his partner near Darwin, and will be extradited from Victoria ahead of his first appearance in the Darwin Local Court.

title.children: Man charged with murder, set to be extradited over partner's death near Darwin

image.altText: Close up of house under construction, frame and windows, no walls, no workers in shot.

props.synopsis: Staff used vile and derogatory terms to describe people dealing with the collapse of their builder, according to a Victorian Ombudsman report.

title.children: State insurer exacerbated stress of Victorian homeowners, finds damning report

image.altText: A Qantas Boeing 737-800 aircraft is seen landing at Sydney Domestic Airport

props.synopsis: A data-entry mistake by a Qantas employee set off a series of errors that caused a Boeing 737 to take off slower than it should have.

title.children: Typing error 'cascaded' into series of mistakes on Qantas flight

image.altText: Two women's badminton doubles athletes are competing wearing green and yellow shirts representing Australia.

props.synopsis: Indonesia's new visa scheme is being touted as a solution to dual citizenship. But some in the Indonesian community say the visa has "no real benefit" and amounts to a government revenue grab.

title.children: New Indonesian visa sparks mixed reaction among diaspora

image.altText: A crystal egg, with snowflake motif, is open to show white gem flowers inside.

props.synopsis: The Winter Egg is made from finely carved rock crystal, covered in a delicate snowflake motif wrought in platinum with 4,500 tiny diamonds.

title.children: Stunning crystal Fabergé egg shatters record, fetching $46m at auction

image.altText: Sabrina Carpenter poses with a serious expression at an event, wearing a red dress with her blonde hair curled

props.synopsis: Two-time Grammy winner Sabrina Carpenter slams the White House for using her song in a social media post about ICE raids, telling the Trump administration to never involve her in its "inhumane agenda".

title.children: Sabrina Carpenter slams White House for using her song in ICE video
